item.title: Berlin, Wary of Bush Legacy, Prepares to Meet Jeb
item.description: Residents of the German capital express unease over the last name of the former Florida governor, who is expected to declare his presidential candidacy.
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE and MICHAEL BARBARO
item.media:description: Jeb Bush will begin a tour of Europe on Tuesday, just days before he is set to declare his presidential candidacy.

item.title: U.S. Will Increase Training of Iraqi Forces Fighting ISIS, Obama Says
item.description: President Obama made the remarks on Iraq at the close of the G-7 summit of world leaders, which was dominated by discussion of how to address Russian aggression in Ukraine.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS
item.media:description: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq, left, met with President Obama at the close of the Group of 7 summit meeting in Germany on Monday.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: How High Can Pakistan’s Air Force Women Fly?
item.description: Hundreds are officers, but there’s no telling when they will be eligible for command.
item.dc:creator: BINA SHAH

item.title: Families of Drone Strike Victims in Yemen File Suit in Washington
item.description: The lawsuit, which seeks no monetary damages, is described by the complainants as an attempt to break through the secrecy surrounding drone strikes.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT SHANE

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Ai Weiwei Trades Politics for Subtlety in First Solo Exhibition in China
item.description: Tourists, fans, and family and friends of the artist flocked to the opening the exhibition to see the show and, more important for many, to catch a glimpse of Mr. Ai.
item.dc:creator: AMY QIN
item.media:description: The installation of an ancestral hall from Jiangxi Province in adjoining galleries forms part of Ai Weiwei's exhibition.

item.title: Tough-Talking El Bronco Poised to Take Mexican Governor’s Race
item.description: A victory in Nuevo León by Jaime Rodríguez Calderón, an independent who was ahead in exit polls, would be an unsettling development for establishment parties.
item.dc:creator: RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
item.media:description: Jaime Rodríguez Calderón, an independent candidate for governor of Nuevo León State, easily defeated his rivals competition on Sunday, according to exit polls.

item.title: Torture and Other Rights Abuses Are Widespread in Eritrea, U.N. Panel Says
item.description: Every month, thousands flee extrajudicial executions, disappearances, forced labor and sexual violence in the East African nation, a report found.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Attack on Nurse Stirs Discussion of a Medical Strike in China
item.description: A discussion on Hippocratic Community, a site catering to medical workers, revealed a profession under siege after years of underfunding by the state and mounting anger from patients fed up with corruption and malpractice.
item.dc:creator: DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: Security personnel cornering a patient who attacked a nurse in a hospital in Kunming on Sunday, in a still from video provided by hospital personnel.

item.title: Recovery of Bodies Brings Confirmed Toll in Yangtze Sinking to 434
item.description: Only 14 of the 456 said to have been aboard the Oriental Star have been found alive, and eight remain missing, the Chinese state news agency reported.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE

item.title: Letter From Jerusalem: Profit as an Incentive for Israeli-Palestinian Peace
item.description: A RAND Corporation report found that the Israeli and Palestinian economies would stand to gain $173 billion over the next decade if an independent Palestine emerged tomorrow.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: An Israeli armored personnel carrier driving near the northern Gaza Strip (in the background) during a military training exercise.

item.title: Global Diabetes Rates Are Rising as Obesity Spreads
item.description: The prevalence of diabetes has been rising in rich countries for several decades, largely driven by increases in the rate of obesity. More recently, poorer countries have begun to follow the trend.
item.category: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
item.dc:creator: SABRINA TAVERNISE

item.title: At Center of FIFA Scandal, a Divisive Politician in Jack Warner
item.description: Warner, a former FIFA official who is accused of racketeering, is a polarizing populist in Trinidad and Tobago whose life has come to resemble Shakespearean theater.
item.category: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
item.dc:creator: JERÉ LONGMAN
item.media:description: The former FIFA official Jack Warner on Friday at the seat of Trinidad and Tobago’s Parliament.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributors: Obama’s Slap in Britain’s Face
item.description: Shaker Aamer, a British resident held at Guantánamo since 2002, has been cleared for release. Why won’t the U.S. act?
item.dc:creator: JEREMY CORBYN, DAVID DAVIS, ANDREW MITCHELL and ANDY SLAUGHTER

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: More Troops Will Head to Iraq
item.description: The new deployment would raise to 275 the number of British personnel helping the Baghdad government and Kurdish authorities battle Islamic State militants.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Italy: Politicians Vow to Spurn Migrants
item.description: Politicians based in the north said they would not shelter any more migrants saved at sea, even as thousands more were being rescued from smugglers’ boats in distress.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Saudi Arabia: Verdict on Blogger Stands
item.description: The Supreme Court upheld an internationally condemned verdict against Raif Badawi, a liberal blogger who was publicly flogged after being found guilty of insulting Islam.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Yemen: Military Headquarters Bombed
item.description: Saudi-led airstrikes before dawn Sunday struck the headquarters of Yemen’s armed forces in Sana, the rebel-held capital, killing at least 22 people, officials said.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Israel: Rocket Attacks Prompt Airstrikes
item.description: Israeli aircraft bombed the Gaza Strip on Sunday after the latest in a series of Palestinian rocket attacks that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accused the international community of ignoring.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Obama Administration Criticizes Egypt in Report to Congress
item.description: Egypt is moving away from democracy, stifling freedom of expression and failing to hold the security forces accountable for “arbitrary or unlawful killings,” the administration said.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: Russia Wields Aid and Ideology Against West to Fight Sanctions
item.description: Moscow is leveraging its economic power, financing European political parties and movements, and spreading alternative accounts of the conflict.
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER and STEVEN ERLANGER
item.media:description: Marine Le Pen of France’s National Front in Moscow in May. Her party has taken money from a bank tied to the Kremlin.
